alfredsnippet.snippet: "... Even some everyday materials can be described as plasmas because they show similarities to the free-electron plasma described above: the conduction electrons in metals and electron hole pairs in semiconductors are charges which can move quasi-freely and lead to a behavior of the matter which can be described in the same way as for a plasma.  The free-electron gas in metals is therefore also included as example of a plasma ..."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Plasma is 99% of Observable Matter - Part 14
